data.question: What is the chemical formula for ZUL-C1?
What is the BET surface area of ZUL-C2 as measured by Ar adsorption at 87 K?
Does ZUL-C1 have a higher Xe uptake capacity at 20 kPa compared to ZUL-C2?
data.answer: False, ZUL-C2 has a higher Xe uptake capacity at 20 kPa compared to ZUL-C1.

data.question: What is the IAST selectivity of ZUL-C2 for C2H6/CH4 (10:85) mixture?
Is the isosteric heat of adsorption (Qst) for C2H6 in ZUL-C2 higher at lower pressures?
data.answer: True, the Qst for C2H6 in ZUL-C2 decreases as the pressure increases.

data.question: What method was used for the structural refinement of activated ZUL-C1?
What is the space group of as-synthesized ZUL-C1 according to the Rietveld-refinement?
Can ZUL-C2 maintain high selectivity and capacity in both CH4/C2H6/C3H8 and Xe/Kr separation after multiple breakthrough tests?
data.answer: True, ZUL-C2 maintained high selectivity and capacity in both separations after multiple tests.

data.question: What is the highest recorded IAST selectivity for C3H8/CH4 (50:50) mixture among the materials listed?
What is the role of the dual-site Langmuir-Freundlich (DSLF) equation in the study?
data.answer: It was used for fitting the single-component adsorption isotherms of gases in ZUL-C1 and ZUL-C2.

data.question: Is ZUL-C2 more effective than ZUL-C1 for the separation of Xe from Kr in a column breakthrough experiment mimicking UNF reprocessing off-gas?
data.answer: True, ZUL-C2 demonstrated a higher Xe capture capacity in the column breakthrough experiment.

data.question: What is the calculated gas density of C3H8 in ZUL-C1?
What is the thermal stability range of ZUL-C2 according to TGA analysis?
data.answer: ZUL-C2 is thermally stable until 623 K.

data.question: Does ZUL-C1 exhibit a higher BET surface area than ZUL-C2?
data.answer: False, ZUL-C2 exhibits a higher BET surface area than ZUL-C1.

data.question: What is the significance of the quasi-three-dimensional pore refinement strategy mentioned in the study?
data.answer: It enables the tunability of both the size and number of aliphatic rings in polycycloalkane-dicarboxylate ligands, resulting in improved gas separation performance.

data.question: What is the Henry's selectivity of ZUL-C2 for Xe/Kr separation?
Can ZUL-C2 effectively separate C2H6 from CH4 at low pressures?
data.answer: True, ZUL-C2 demonstrates a high C2H6 uptake at low pressures, indicating effective separation.

data.question: What is the role of the Clausius-Clapeyron equation in the study?
data.answer: It was used to calculate the isosteric heat of adsorption (Qst) for gases in ZUL-C1 and ZUL-C2.

data.question: What is the calculated gas occupancy of C2H6 in ZUL-C2?
Is the IAST selectivity for C3H8/CH4 (5:85) mixture higher in ZUL-C2 compared to ZUL-C1?
data.answer: True, ZUL-C2 exhibits a significantly higher IAST selectivity for the C3H8/CH4 mixture compared to ZUL-C1.
